results.content:
Really like this course as a Javascript primer. I would really suggest having some exposure HTML, and some Java or Python because it will really help with the Javascript syntax. I could image myself a little confused on some of the topics he covers early in the course if I didn't have some programming experience. 

As a primer, it's a lot easier to listen to him talk than read all the documentation to identify the differences between Javascript and other OOP languages.
results.content_html:
Really like this course as a Javascript primer. I would really suggest having some exposure HTML, and some Java or Python because it will really help with the Javascript syntax. I could image myself a little confused on some of the topics he covers early in the course if I didn't have some programming experience.

As a primer, it's a lot easier to listen to him talk than read all the documentation to identify the differences between Javascript and other OOP languages.

results.content: A bit more explanation needed at certain stages. Especially when the project is loaded on netbeans and explain the way to run the projects. In case of error, how to follow up.

response.content:
Hello,

You do not run a project on netbeans. JavaScript runs on webbrowser. You just open html file that has js connected to it and that's all :) Netbeans is used for the sake of easier editing of code.

There is more about debugging in bonus section :)

If you have any questions feel free to ask.

Best regards!
response.content_html:
Hello,

You do not run a project on netbeans. JavaScript runs on webbrowser. You just open html file that has js connected to it and that's all :) Netbeans is used for the sake of easier editing of code.

There is more about debugging in bonus section :)

If you have any questions feel free to ask.

Best regards!

results.content_html: A bit more explanation needed at certain stages. Especially when the project is loaded on netbeans and explain the way to run the projects. In case of error, how to follow up.

results.content: You are very precise about what you are going to teach and how. Also, at what pace we should take this course. Your honesty is pretty much appreciated. I am liking this course so far. The only problem here is that everything that you are teaching is essentially basic JS skills in the real world.

Hello Eliezer,

Thank you for your feedback :)

Basics are at start :) I have to start from basics because this course is especially for beginners.

In future lectures you will get to advanced topics.

If you have any questions feel free to ask :)

Best regards,

Arkadiusz W.

results.content: Excellent course. The professor is very knowledgable of Javascript and breaks his lessons down to the simpliest form. There are times where i wish he would explain a little more about what hes doing (binary section- the only reason i made it through this part was because I already knew most of whats going on, to a new person this could be incredibily confusing) but overall great course, definitely reccomend.

response.content: Thanks for your review Sidney :) I tried my best to explain this topic, it might be confusing for people who are new to programming. Fortunately bitwise operator lecture can be skipped by almost anyone. It's very very rarely used in JavaScript world :) If you have any questions feel free to ask, I'm always here to help you!
response.content_html: Thanks for your review Sidney :) I tried my best to explain this topic, it might be confusing for people who are new to programming. results.content: I just finished this course!  I feel so accomplished, though I know this is just the beginning of my journey.  I am about to enter a coding bootcamp, and this course gave me the confidence to do so.  The instructor moves at a great pace, his examples are clear and easy to reproduce.  Although he does not give you assignments, he does use examples that inspire you to find your own solutions or to create your own original ideas.  I want to brush up on html5 and css3 next.  If the instructor offered courses in these subjects, I would definitely take them.  As of now he does not.  However, when I'm ready for grunt or compass I will most certainly return to his course list.

response.content: Thank you Sarah :-) If you have any questions feel free to ask! Best regards and good luck on your web development adventure :)
response.content_html: Thank you Sarah :-) If you have any questions feel free to ask! Best regards and good luck on your web development adventure :)

results.content_html: I just finished this course! I feel so accomplished, though I know this is just the beginning of my journey. I am about to enter a coding bootcamp, and this course gave me the confidence to do so. The instructor moves at a great pace, his examples are clear and easy to reproduce. Although he does not give you assignments, he does use examples that inspire you to find your own solutions or to create your own original ideas. I want to brush up on html5 and css3 next. If the instructor offered courses in these subjects, I would definitely take them. As of now he does not. However, when I'm ready for grunt or compass I will most certainly return to his course list.

results.content: Overall a very good course. I went into it with a solid programming background, but no JavaScript knowledge. I now feel confident writing solid JavaScript.
results.content_html: Overall a very good course. I went into it with a solid programming background, but no JavaScript knowledge. I now feel confident writing solid JavaScript.

results.content: I'm almost done with the course and I've learned a lot. Sometimes the Instructor will show more than one scenario then tell you which one he thinks is best to use. Throughout the course he will cover real world JS code that you might use in your website. If you are new to JS then you'll learn a lot from this course

results.content: Arkadiusz really knows what he is talking about. From the point of knowledge 5 Stars. For the teaching I give 4 Stars. If the teaching is going to be improved, 5 Stars would be result.  Summary: Very good course with a lot of useful information.

I have a programing background and needed a quick and concise entry on using Javascript, specifically how it relates to the Document Object Model.

results.content: The pace is fairly slow to start with but I found it filled in gaps for me, so would be very helpful for a beginner. If you're restless (like me)  set the player to 1.5x and persevere! From section 11 it gets pretty intense and I needed to stop and explore the ideas. There are lots of tips that relate to supporting outdated IE browsers that are probably irrelevant for new developments in 2017 but helpful for understanding older code. Also, there are lots of useful hints & tips provided. Really great course.

results.content:
Generally happy with the course. Here are a few improvements I would like to have:
1. One or several tasks after each topic (where applicable)
2. Leave no top level explained topics. Example is topic about 'strict mode'. I find it useful to provide more details on why it is used, where and how.
3. Some times it happened that I was frustrated at the middle of a lesson. The reason is that author kept playing (fixing) or typing code without commenting why something has changed, i.e. how that piece is interconnected with the whole code. So some retrospective of whole picture may be of help in such situations

response.content:
Hey Colburn,

Thanks for feedback :-) Sorry if that caused you a problem. Don't worry about my worfklow tho. Netbeans is only IDE. You can use whatever IDE you want. You can even write in Notepad++ (many programmers do) or use Notepad++. There are also many other advanced IDE's like Aptana Studio. The workflow, the IDE is something that must be nice to you. My Javascript course is not IDE dependant :) If you have any questions regarding covered topics or any issues just send me a message I will try to help you as fast possible :) Best regards and good luck!
response.content_html:

Arkadiusz W.

results.content_html: Great tutor. He tries his very best to explain things. His lessons are short and meticulously explained throughout each lesson. Easy to follow and quickly learn intuitive techniques of generating ideas and concepts in designing your script.

results.content: Nice introductory video.,but uptill 45 lecture , Arkadius is good but not a good teacher for beginners. Too fast and not too good for beginners like me.

Best regards! 

Arkadiusz W.

results.content: Working through this course and am finding it fairly easy to follow along as a beginner. However, I wish that the instructor would stop showing us things that we should not use, such as the styling in JS  (In with the DOM lessons). I want to know best practices and prefer to not even see the "could do's. He is fairly easy to understand and he breaks things down pretty well.

response.content:
Hi,

Thanks for your valuable feedback.

I understand your point! I did it, because I think you need to know how to do all possible things in order to know how to work with a code written by other people :)

Best regards,

Arkadiusz W.

results.content: It would be nice to see more complex examples. I've got the basics.

response.content:
Hey Sam,

Thanks for your feedback .

There are tons of advanced examples in future. If you know the basics you can jump to further lessons :) From Section 11 there is tons of useful examples. Section 21 is full of exercises. You will create slideshows, animations, galleries with thumbnails and so on :) There is nothing complex to show until you get to Section 11 because people do not have enough information. 

If you have any questions feel free to ask :)

Best regards,

Arkadiusz W.
